title: Data-Driven Customized Mathematics Curriculum Design: Optimizing Conceptual Understanding Through Learning Analytics

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematical concepts (equations, functions, statistics) and experience applying mathematics in workplace environments (e.g., data analysis, budget calculations)
context.additional_context: Curriculum design optimized for smartphone-based learning activities (e.g., mobile graphing calculators, probability simulation apps). Case-centered structure to strengthen learner-task relevance (e.g., applying statistical models for work data analysis, using equations for project budget calculations).

learning_goals: Visualize understanding patterns of mathematical concepts (e.g., equations, functions, statistics) per learner with 80% accuracy using learning analytics (LA) tools.

Design at least three personalized feedback strategies (e.g., error type analysis, supplementary problem recommendations, concept-specific learning path adjustments) based on learner data (diagnostic assessment results, learning logs).

Derive at least five requirements for improving mathematics learning environments (e.g., graph interpretation tools, probability concept visualization materials) through qualitative research techniques (interviews).

Establish at least three concrete improvement strategies (e.g., personalized equation-solving path design, supplementary statistics materials, geometry visualization tools) for mathematics curricula using learning analytics data (diagnostic assessments, learning logs), implement them in at least one actual educational setting (classroom/course), and achieve over 80% teacher/student satisfaction evaluations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
